model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Neighbors A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Neighbors A: It's great to have friends who can help each other out, isn't it?
Neighbors B: Absolutely. It's a two-way street, and it's important to be there for each other.
Neighbors A: I remember when I helped you move last year, and then you watched my cat when I went on vacation.
Neighbors B: Yes, and I appreciate it so much. It's always nice to have someone you can count on.

[MEMORY]
Neighbors A stumbled upon Neighbors B's shop while looking for a new necklace and received a suggestion. Neighbors A thanked Neighbors B for the help and now wants earrings for an upcoming wedding. Both neighbors discussed the challenge of not being able to adopt all animals they see but admire those who do, and also agreed on the strength required for apologizing.
